oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Fairs; Exhibition buildings; Circus animals; Circuses & shows; Sideshows; Trained animals
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of the front entrance of Gorman & Boone's Arena of Wild and Trained Animals at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. People are standing at the entrance. A carriage is located in the foreground.

Entertainment and amusement were a part of great fairs and expositions. At the Tennessee Centennial, various shows from all parts of the world were centered in one street called "Vanity Fair." This area provided the fairgoer with a choice of many strange and exotic entertainments, including the one pictured here. Children especially enjoyed this amusement, with its lions and monkeys.
